holidays.name: Siblings Day
holidays.description: A day to celebrate the special bond, love, and lifelong support between siblings.
holidays.origin: Created in 1995 by Claudia Evart to honor her siblings who died in a plane crash, it has since gained popularity internationally.
holidays.funFact: Unlike Mother's or Father's Day, Siblings Day is not yet a federal holiday in the U.S., but millions still celebrate online and in person.

holidays.name: National Cinnamon Crescent Day
holidays.description: Celebrate this delicious pastry by savoring warm, flaky, cinnamon-filled crescents‚Äîperfect for breakfast or a sweet snack.
holidays.origin: An unofficial food day dedicated to the cinnamon crescent, popular in bakeries around the world.
holidays.funFact: Cinnamon crescents trace their roots back to European pastries and gained massive popularity in American bakeries in the 20th century.

holidays.name: Parker Brothers Day
holidays.description: A day to honor the founders of Parker Brothers, the game company famous for creating Monopoly and many other family-favorite board games.
holidays.origin: Celebrates the birth of George S. Parker (born April 10, 1866), who founded the iconic board game company.
holidays.funFact: Monopoly was almost called 'The Landlord‚Äôs Game' and was designed to teach players about the dangers of monopolies!

holidays.name: Cheer-Up the Lonely Day
holidays.description: A heartwarming day encouraging people to reach out and brighten the day of someone feeling lonely or isolated.
holidays.origin: Started in the 20th century as a compassionate reminder to connect with others and spread kindness.
holidays.funFact: Small acts of kindness on this day can spark long-lasting friendships and brighten entire communities.
